00021 #ifndef _AffymetrixBaseTypes_HEADER_
00022 #define _AffymetrixBaseTypes_HEADER_
00023 
00024 /*! \file AffymetrixBaseTypes.h This file provides type definitions for atom types.
00025  */ 
00026 
00027 /* Define the type for the Windows platform. */
00028 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00029 
00030 #ifndef __MINGW32__
00031 
00032 /*! An 8 bit signed number */
00033 typedef char int8_t;
00034 
00035 /*! A 16 bit signed number */
00036 typedef short int int16_t;
00037 
00038 /*! A 32 bit signed number */
00039 typedef int int32_t;
00040 
00041 /*! A 64 bit signed number */
00042 typedef long long int int64_t;
00043 
00044 /*! An 8 bit unsigned number */
00045 typedef unsigned char u_int8_t;
00046 
00047 /*! A 16 bit unsigned number */
00048 typedef unsigned short int u_int16_t;
00049 
00050 /*! A 32 bit unsigned number */
00051 typedef unsigned int u_int32_t;
00052 
00053 /*! A 64 bit unsigned number */
00054 typedef unsigned long long int u_int64_t;
00055 
00056 #else // __MINGW32__
00057 
00058 /*! An 8 bit unsigned number */
00059 typedef unsigned char u_int8_t;
00060 
00061 /*! A 16 bit unsigned number */
00062 typedef unsigned short int u_int16_t;
00063 
00064 /*! A 32 bit unsigned number */
00065 typedef unsigned int u_int32_t;
00066 
00067 /*! A 64 bit unsigned number */
00068 typedef unsigned long long int u_int64_t;
00069 
00070 #endif // __MINGW32__
00071 
00072 #else // WIN32
00073 
00074 /* Use the sys/types.h for non Windows platforms */
00075 #include <sys/types.h>
00076 
00077 #ifndef sun
00078 #include <stdint.h>
00079 #else // sun
00080 
00081 /*! An 8 bit unsigned number */
00082 typedef unsigned char u_int8_t;
00083 
00084 /*! A 16 bit unsigned number */
00085 typedef unsigned short int u_int16_t;
00086 
00087 /*! A 32 bit unsigned number */
00088 typedef unsigned int u_int32_t;
00089 
00090 /*! A 64 bit unsigned number */
00091 typedef unsigned long long int u_int64_t;
00092 
00093 #endif // sun
00094 
00095 #endif //WIN32
00096 
00097 //////////

00100 /* This is also in "affy-base-types.h"
00101  * Be sure to only get it once.  (keep them in sync!)
00102  * The documentation is there too.
00103  */
00104 #ifndef _AFFY_TYPE_PUNNED_
00105 #define _AFFY_TYPE_PUNNED_
00106 
00107 union type_punned {
00108   float v_float;
00109   int v_int32;
00110   unsigned int v_uint32;
00111 };
